answers.answer: Hi there.  How frustrating.  Well, I would request another test.  Drug testers are required to keep some of the sample for this purpose and it is sent to another lab.  If you are sure you have not used cocaine, there should be no reason for it being in your system.  Even if your boyfriend uses it.  Kidney issues and diabetes have been known to cause a false positive though.Personally, I'd never have a boyfriend that used cocaine.  That is just asking for a difficult life to attach to someone with drug issues.but ask for the test to be done again and go from there.  good luck
Make sure he's not preparing your meals or drinks for a while. Then if your test comes up negative you'll know why.

On top of the above suggestions, make sure to use a condom (if you don't already) just in case.  I'm not sure if it can be found in semen, but at the very least, I've heard about people using their drug to sustain themselves/make things more intense, so...I'd just avoid sexual contact especially if it is without a condom.

question: I don't use cocaine but my boyfriend does. But when I take UA it come up, why is that?
title: Cocaine
